Description:

Description:

Title: Fashion risks going backwards on diversity, says ex-Vogue boss
Description: The former British Vogue editor says being "super-thin" and European is often seen as "the norm" again.

Title: Meta AI is evolving again, and it's resurrecting the metaverse

Title: Android 16 QPR2 Beta 2 rolls out with customizable app icons and fitness upgrades for Pixel users
Description: Google has officially launched Android 16 QPR2 Beta 2 for Pixel devices as of September 17, introducing exciting features like customizable icons and enhanced fitness tracking, while advancing its commitment to app security in the evolving digital landscape.

Title: Your Google Pixel 10 is now eligible to test the future of Android
Description: Google Pixel 10 users reported new eligibility for Android 16 QPR beta tests via the Beta Program.

Title: What does the Google antitrust ruling mean for the future of AI?
Description: A federal judge's mild ruling in the Justice Department's suit over Google's search engine monopoly has critics worried that the tech giant can now monopolize artificial intelligence.

Title: Kirk shooting videos spread online, even to viewers who didn't want to see them
Description: Graphic videos of the Charlie Kirk shooting spread widely online, raising concerns over the emotional and political toll of exposure to violent imagery.

Title: To save its unique and rare birds, New Zealand is turning to AI and genetic research
Description:
New Zealand is planning to eradicate millions of invasive animals that prey on the country's rare birds.
The goal may not be possible, unless new technology can be developed to do it.

Title: New policies are making life harder for trans people — and prompting big financial decisions
Description:
White House executive orders and legislation in many states have targeted the rights and protections of trans people.
For some, that has meant increased financial worry.

Title: Waymo's aggressive strategy to get you inside a robotaxi is coming into view
Description: Waymo is using partnerships with ride-hailing giants like Uber and Lyft as one strategy to get more riders inside its robotaxis.
